metadata.synopsis: After Wulbren instigates the escape any escaping prisoners try to make it to the boat and flee Moonrise. This dialogue covers the case in which the boat leaves without the player or joins them in the escape.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Click on the boat in MOO prison tunnels. The boat is a one-way trip to HAV.

13.speaker: Lia
13.text: Right, boat's good to go - or as good as it can get, at least.
13.context: NodeContext: tense but relieved - they've made it to the boat and are about to flee moonrise

88.speaker: Lia
88.text: What I do need though, is a destination. You mentioned somewhere earlier, Last Light was it?

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Let's go there together - I'll show you the way.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: It's to the east - you'll be safe there.

4.speaker: Lia
4.text: This curse doesn't stretch much further than the shore. We'll hide out on the water, plan our next move from there.
4.context: NodeContext: trying to take things one step at a time

14.speaker: Lakrissa
14.text: The boat's good to go - at least, I think it is. I'm no sailor.
14.context: NodeContext: tense but relieved -they've made it to the boat and are about to flee moonrise

65.speaker: Lakrissa
65.text: You mentioned somewhere earlier - Last Light was it? How do we get there?

23.speaker: Lakrissa
23.text: Or strategist, to be honest. My plan is to stick to the water, stay clear of the curse - until I think of something better.
23.context: NodeContext: trying to take things one step at a time

19.speaker: Danis
19.text: I - I can't wait any longer. I'm sorry, I'm so sorry.
19.context: NodeContext: calling out to player (who might be fighting far away) Ashamed - he's about to leave the player to die.

20.speaker: The Warden
20.text: You. I'll cut your limbs off and feed them to the gnolls, you disgusting little TRAITOR.
20.context: NodeContext: this is a threat that builds up to a vicious roar as the warden SCREAMS this voice at the player in battle (prisoners have just sailed away)

33.speaker: Lakrissa
33.text: We can't wait any longer. Forgive me.
33.context: NodeContext: calling out to player (who might be fighting far away) Ashamed - about to leave the player to die

34.speaker: Danis
34.text: We're ready. At least - I think we are.
34.context: NodeContext: tense but relieved -they've made it to the boat and are about to flee moonrise

86.speaker: Danis
86.text: That place you'd mentioned, what was it called? Last Light?

18.speaker: Danis
18.text: Not like we have somewhere to go, but the water seems safe from the curse - for now, anyway.
18.context: NodeContext: trying to take things one step at a time

41.speaker: Cal
41.text: All I want is to lie down and sleep for a tenday, but we're not safe yet.
41.context: NodeContext: tense but relieved - they've made it to the boat and are about to flee moonrise

67.speaker: Cal
67.text: We need somewhere to bunker down - somewhere safe. You mentioned a place, Last Light was it?

75.speaker: Cal
75.text: We'll get this thing onto the water, far from the curse, and plan our next move.
75.context: NodeContext: trying to take things one step at a time

42.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
42.text: There's no time! I'm leaving - hold them off.
42.context: NodeContext: Yelling. Authorative and grave - he's about to flee while the player fights enemies off

22.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
22.text: If I die, every Ironhand Gnome in the realm will suffer. I cannot risk it - goodbye.
22.context: NodeContext: player has asked wulbren to wait for them, wulbren refused. Cold and determined.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: You ungrateful bastard, don't you dare leave.

7.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
7.text: I must - the Ironhand Gnomes need me. I will tell them of your heroic sacrifice.
7.context: NodeContext: authorative and grave - knows he's leaving the player to die

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Leave me and I'll bring the wrath of the divine down upon you.

21.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
21.text: The fates are already against me, what does the divine matter? Good luck - I hope in the end, you don't suffer.
21.context: NodeContext: authorative and grave - knows he's leaving the player to die

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Take the boat and go! They won't get past me.

98.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
98.text: In another life, you'd have made an excellent Ironhand Gnome. Farewell.
98.context: NodeContext: authorative and grave - knows he's leaving the player to die

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I will not fall in battle - we will meet again.

5.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
5.text: You will kill many, I have no doubt. But should you fall... I hope it's quick. Thank you.
5.context: NodeContext: authorative and grave - knows he's leaving the player to die

29.speaker: Player
29.text: You coward! This is not how you get a ballad written about you.

111.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
111.text: Ballads won't save my people, only action will - and I can do nothing if I'm dead. Farewell.
111.context: NodeContext: authorative and grave - knows he's leaving the player to die

26.speaker: Player
26.text: You'd abandon one of your own so easily?

12.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
12.text: One of my own to save the rest? Aye - if that's what it takes. Farewell.
12.context: NodeContext: authorative and grave - knows he's leaving the player to die

56.speaker: Player
56.text: I should have known better than to save a gnome.

49.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
49.text: Maybe. But you'll be the first drow celebrated by the Ironhand Gnomes - consider it an honour! Farewell.
49.context: NodeContext: authorative and grave - knows he's leaving the player to die

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Only cowards flee a battle unfinished.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: A battle divided is a battle lost - stay and finish this.

52.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
52.text: The Ironhand Gnomes thank you - your sacrifice will be remembered.
52.context: NodeContext: Yelling. Authorative and grave - he's about to flee while the player fights enemies off

53.speaker: Cal
53.text: We can't wait any longer, I'm sorry.
53.context: NodeContext: calling out to player (who might be fighting far away) Ashamed - about to leave the player to die

61.speaker: Nickels
61.text: The boat calls. The thought of leaving the comfort of stone makes my heart pound - but I have no choice.
61.context: NodeContext: tense but relieved - they've made it to the boat and are about to flee moonrise

24.speaker: Nickels
24.text: The curse touches every part of this land. Only the water is safe - an unhappy prospect.

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *The current is powerful, pulling at the boat. Should you leave, you will not be able to return to Moonrise Towers this way.*

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Set out - ready for wherever the tide takes you.

74.speaker: Nimble
74.text: I'm no sailor, but I've prepped the boat as best I can.
74.context: NodeContext: tense but relieved -they've made it to the boat and are about to flee moonrise

103.speaker: Nimble
103.text: I don't know this hellscape. We can hide out from the curse on the water, I guess.

92.speaker: Nimble
92.text: We can't wait. Give the bastards hell for us!
92.context: NodeContext: Yelling. Ferocious - she's about to flee - leaving the player behind to die

95.speaker: Lia
95.text: Damn it all, the boat's leaving. I'm sorry!
95.context: NodeContext: calling out to player (who might be fighting far away) Angry and ashamed - she's about to leave the player to die.

99.speaker: Nickels
99.text: I'm sorry, I must go now. I'm so sorry.
99.context: NodeContext: calling out to player (who might be fighting far away). Ashamed - about to leave the player to die

101.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
101.text: Boat's good to go - all that's left is to ship off.
101.context: NodeContext: tense but relieved - they've made it to the boat and are about to flee moonrise

0.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
0.text: My plan, for now, is to hide out on the water. Unless you have a better idea?

48.speaker: Player
48.text: I don't - but I'll join you on the boat. We'll see where we end up.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I'll join you on the water - we'll see where we end up.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: I don't think there's anywhere else for you to go. Good luck out there.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I'll come with you - I know a place called the Last Light Inn. You'll be safe there.

51.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
51.text: 'Safe'? No small claim in these parts. Lead the damn way.

54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Low shot of boat sailing away from camera, slowly panning up to show occupants from behind (whoever is available, sitting in assigned spots. Player character included.)

77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Low shot of boat sailing away from camera, slowly panning up to show occupants from behind (whoever is available, sitting in assigned spots. Party not included.)

110.speaker: Nimble
110.text: Somewhere survived the curse? Count me in.

43.speaker: Nickels
43.text: That is a relief - I do not know how long I could have tolerated the water. Thank you.

10.speaker: Lia
10.text: Music to my ears, let's get out of this shit-heap.

109.speaker: Cal
109.text: Have I mentioned I'm really really glad we met? Let's go.

89.speaker: Lakrissa
89.text: Always saving the day - I knew there was a reason I liked you. Let's get out of this dump.

9.speaker: Danis
9.text: Somewhere in this cursed land is safe? Lead the way - please!

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Look to the east for the Last Light Inn. You'll be welcome there.

28.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
28.text: Something survived in this hellscape? You should've lead with that. See you there.

73.speaker: Nimble
73.text: I knew Gaerdal wouldn't steer me wrong. Thank you - maybe I'll see you there.

59.speaker: Nickels
59.text: That is a relief - I do not know how long I could have tolerated the water. May we meet on dry land soon.

87.speaker: Lia
87.text: Blessed Tymora, you're sometimes good to me. I'll leave while it's quiet, but you better not be far behind, you hear?
87.context: NodeContext: relieved, eager to go. Worried about the player in second line (big sister vibes here)

30.speaker: Cal
30.text: Just when I think I'm out of luck, you come along change that. Thank you - I hope to see you at Last Light, and soon.

58.speaker: Lakrissa
58.text: I knew there was a reason I liked you - you always have the answer. I better see you at Last Light, and in one piece.

84.speaker: Danis
84.text: Thank the gods. I'll head out now, while it's quiet, but I hope to see you at Last Light.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: All I know is that the sooner you leave, the better.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: If I were you, I'd stay on the water. But it's your call.

108.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
108.text: Now that is a plan I can get behind.
108.context: NodeContext: confident and determined - he's in control

78.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
78.text: From me and every Ironhand Gnome in the realm - thank you. You've done more than you could ever know.
78.context: NodeContext: thanking player but really he doesn't care - he just needed the player to escape

107.speaker: Nimble
107.text: True - who knows what could come charging out of Moonrise next. Thank you - the Ironhands will remember this.

96.speaker: Nickels
96.text: Indeed. If I meant to survive, then I will. But know this: the stone in Moonrise screams. Something evil is here, you should leave while you can.

17.speaker: Lia
17.text: Fair, you've done more than your share - I can take it from here.
17.context: NodeContext: taking charge even tho she has no idea where to go next - determined to be strong

91.speaker: Lia
91.text: But listen - heard the guards in a tizzy over something big - an army. Whatever these arseholes are up to, it isn't good. Get out - and soon.
91.context: NodeContext: concerned for the player who is staying behind

37.speaker: Cal
37.text: If Elturel has taught me one thing, it's that there's always a way out. Thank you - for everything.
37.context: NodeContext: taking charge even tho he has no idea where to go next - determined to be strong

64.speaker: Lakrissa
64.text: True, I'm pushing my luck just standing here. But I can't leave without a warning.
64.context: NodeContext: taking charge even tho she has no idea where to go next - determined to be strong

100.speaker: Lakrissa
100.text: I heard whispers inside of something big - an army. Do what you have to here, and then scarper. Please.

15.speaker: Danis
15.text: True - anywhere is better than here.
15.context: NodeContext: worried but trying to be confident

6.speaker: Danis
6.text: But I can't leave without saying this - something big is going on in Moonrise. I heard whispers of something - an army. Do what you have to here, and then leave. Soon.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Stop talking - just get on the damn boat!
